intro: Pycreus nervulosus, commonly known as the slender pycreus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
